content: four stitches change to dpn when needed start the decrease at the round that corresponds to the co 48co start at d1 d1 *k21 cdd place sm* x 2 44 d2 k22 remove sm k1 replace sm k21 remove sm k1 replace sm 44co start at d3 d3 *k19 cdd place sm* x 2 40 d4 k20 remove sm k1 replace sm k19 remove sm k1 replace sm 40co start at d5 d5 *k17 cdd place sm* x 2 36 d6 k18 remove sm k1 replace sm k17 remove sm k1 replace sm d7 *k15 cdd* x 2 32 d8 k16 remove sm k1 replace sm k15 remove sm k1 replace sm d9 *k13 cdd* x 2 28 d10 k14 remove sm k1 replace sm k13 remove sm k1 replace sm d11 *k11 cdd* x 2 24 d12 k12 remove sm k1 replace sm k11 remove sm k1 replace sm d13 *k9 cdd* x 2 20 d14 k10 remove sm k1 replace sm k9 remove sm k1 replace sm d15 *k7 cdd* x 2 16 d16 k8 remove sm k1 replace sm k7 remove sm k1 replace sm d17 *k5 cdd* x 2 12 d18 k6 remove sm k1 replace sm k5 remove sm k1 replace sm 2026 unraveled handknits - ice-crusher beanie page 3 d19 *k3 cdd* x 2 8 d20 k4 remove sm k1 replace sm k3 remove sm k1 replace sm d21 *k1 cdd* x 2 4 d22 k2 k2tog 3 finish knit three remaining sts as an i-cord for 2 - 3 or desired length cut yarn and pull through sts attach tassel weave in ends i-cord step by step note you will have three stitches on your needle no additional stitches are cast on https //www purlsoho com/create/i-cord/ srsltid=afmboor_- yzwceelwni3kinqhifqppaij6vjwyb-mstkunojioaszeos tassel there are many videos or photo tutorials for making a tassel some links are below for mine i wrap my yarn about 8-10 times to get to the desired fullness https //doradoes co uk/2019/05/25/how-to-make-a-yarn-tassel-in-5-minutes-step-by- step-photo-tutorial/ https //www youtube com/watch v=h144rix4mti 2026 unraveled handknits -
